title: card.io Request Application Programming Interface (API) Schema
description: Can be used to override the Notecard's I2C address from its default of `0x17` and change behaviors of the onboard LED and USB port.

i2c.description: The alternate address to use for I2C communication. Pass `-1` to [reset](https://dev.blues.io/notecard/notecard-walkthrough/essential-requests/#resetting-request-argument-values) to the default address

sub-descriptions.description: Set to `"-usb"` to disable the Notecard's USB port. Re-enable the USB port with `"usb"` or `"+usb"`.
If set to `"+busy"`, the Notecard's LED will be on when the Notecard is awake, and off when the Notecard goes to sleep.
Resets `"+busy"` to its default, making the onboard LED blink only during Notecard flash memory operations.
Disables Notecard acting as an I2C master. Re-enable by using `"i2c-master-enable"`.

Setting `"+fallback"` while Notecard is paired with a Starnote device forces fallback mode: Wi-Fi and cellular are automatically failed over, and all traffic goes through NTN. This state persists across reboots and therefore is discouraged for use in production deployments because it can incur unexpectedly high satellite data costs.
Resets `"+fallback"` to its default state, ensuring fallback mode is only enabled if cellular/Wi-Fi are not available.

samples.description: Keep LED On While Notecard Awake.
Disable Notecard Acting As I2C Master.
